snippet: Ramadan, a month of fasting for Muslims, coincides with the Games, so a nontheological consultancy created Iftar 2012, celebrations of fast-breaking that are open to Olympic athletes, spectators and local residents.
abstract: Ramadan, a month of fasting for Muslims, coincides with the Games, so a nontheological consultancy created Iftar 2012, celebrations of fast-breaking that are open to Olympic athletes, spectators and local residents.

headline.main: Celebrations of Fast-Breaking Unite Muslims and Non-Muslims
